text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ed1e4c9a70aaa7de56bac23e75a846e874a32a56|patch 8.2.2237: CI on Mac fails in sed command>
patch 8.2.2237: CI on Mac fails in sed command

Problem:    CI on Mac fails in sed command.
Solution:   Set LC_ALL to "C". (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #7565)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2237: CI on Mac fails in sed command · vim/vim@ed1e4c9
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2237: CI on Mac fails in sed command · vim/vim@ed1e4c9
attachments.text: Problem: CI on Mac fails in sed command. Solution: Set LC_ALL to "C". (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #7565)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/746670604a60cb0356b56c112ffb6d297c679099|patch 8.2.2236: 'scroll' option can change when setting the statusline>
patch 8.2.2236: 'scroll' option can change when setting the statusline

Problem:    'scroll' option can change when setting the statusline or tabline
            but the option context is not updated.
Solution:   Update the script context when the scroll option is changed as a
            side effect. (Christian Brabandt, closes #7533)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2236: 'scroll' option can change when setting the statusline · vim/vim@7466706
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2236: 'scroll' option can change when setting the statusline · vim/vim@7466706
attachments.text: Problem: &#39;scroll&#39; option can change when setting the statusline or tabline but the option context is not updated. Solution: Update the script context when the scroll option...

Solution:   Skip the test where it is expected to fail.

patch 8.2.2233: cannot convert a byte index into a character index

Solution:   Add charidx(). (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #7561)

patch 8.2.2232: compiler error for falling through into next case

Problem:    Compiler error for falling through into next case.
Solution:   Move FALLTHROUGH below the #endif

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e4862a0fe62261754daf476866ef2aa8586b716c|patch 8.2.2231: when "--remote file" is used "file" is not reloaded>
patch 8.2.2231: when "--remote file" is used "file" is not reloaded

Problem:    When "--remote file" is used "file" is not reloaded.
Solution:   When a :drop command is used for a file that is already displayed
            in a window and it has not been changed, check if it needs to be
            reloaded. (closes #7560)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4389f9cd00632adc0216d5ead13d859b186bcbf8|patch 8.2.2228: Vim9: cannot use ":e #" because # starts a comment>
patch 8.2.2228: Vim9: cannot use ":e #" because # starts a comment

Problem:    Vim9: cannot use ":e #" because # starts a comment.
Solution:   Support using %% instead of #.

attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot use ":e #" because # starts a comment. Solution: Support using %% instead of #.
